answerText: heparin[10] Thrombin is formed from the proteolysis of the zymogen prothrombin which obtains it structure through the aid of this vitamin, which aids in the addition of alpha carboxylated glutamate residues.

question: Question: It is abundantly expressed in a surface zone of chondrocytes in cartilage and is composed of a DÂ¬-Glucuronate and a D-glucosamine linked by an alpha linkage.  [10] Name this disaccharide glycosaminoglycan that binds strongly to antithrombin III and inhibits blood clotting.
